intro: Actinocephalus pachyphyllus, commonly known as the thick-leafed actinocephalus, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its dense, fleshy leaves that store water, a feature adapted to its arid environment. It produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
